item.title: Glacor
item.dc:creator: @mihalich mihalich
item.description:
@mihalich wrote:

[quote=“rip4d, post:12, topic:414880”][quote author=mihalich link=topic=516842.msg3753956#msg3753956 date=1316282422]

Technically shards of Armadyl are worth 40k if you grind them and craft the dust into armadyl runes at 99 runecrafting. If towards an Armadyl Battlestaff they’re worth 200k if the staff is sold at 20M.

Yes but shards aren’t every kill, took me about 30 kills for my first one. BTW staff is worth 100s of mils atm.
[/quote]Yeah, shards seem to be 1/10 for most people though. If its selling for 200m (like a saw in a vid), 2M per shard then, plus whatever boots you get.[/quote]
Boots are few and far between as well and with the price of runes right now you lose a lot of cash if you’re not getting boots.

Read full topic

item.title: Glacor
item.dc:creator: @mihalich mihalich
item.description:
@mihalich wrote:

[quote=“noobicus, post:7, topic:414880”][quote author=mihalich link=topic=516842.msg3753849#msg3753849 date=1316276784]

Yeah, i saw these the first day it came out… if you guys noticed… in the quest, when azzandra calls the “Wrath of zaros” upon lucius, he hits a 9001

And i guess these are like dragons, frost dragons or something (Because people would kill them constantly for money :P)
But maybe not as much considering they wont be a 100% drop.

Nothing like a dragon at all lol
[/quote]
I don’t know why I said that… i meant kind of as a steady money making… you know how people collect frost dragon bones…[/quote]
Barely steady at Glacors.

Read full topic

item.title: Glacor
item.dc:creator: @mihalich mihalich
item.description:
@mihalich wrote:

vManlyMan:

I’ve never heard of these things. What do they drop? And nice cape btw.

New monster you get access to after ROTM, they drop the new steadfast, ragefire and glaiven boots.

RuneScape Wiki

Glacor

Glacors (pronounced GLAY-soars) are fairly dangerous monsters, described by Beauty as "a rare form of ice elemental". These monsters are only accessible after completing the quest Ritual of the Mahjarrat. You can reach glacors in the Glacor Cave...

Read full topic
